Case reference: 2016068715.CaseDesc: On July 21, 2013, the body of an adult male was found floating in the Niagara River across from the Youngstown Marina, near the Niagara on the Lake yacht club. Anthropological analysis has suggested that he is black, although there are some features which suggest that he may be mixed Black and Caucasian. He is described as obese however this may be due to post-mortem changes. He is thought to have been in the water for at least one year, and possibly a few years.

Case reference: 2018009360.CaseDesc: On February 18, 1987, George Christie was last seen at the intersection of Broadview Avenue and Queen Street East in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2006008399.CaseDesc: Joseph Niro last contacted his daughter by telephone on June 02, 1999. He was last seen on June 20, 1999.

Hair: Black, Long, Wavy, Parted to the right

Case reference: 2014005006.CaseDesc: On September 10, 2007, Sun Jin, her husband Joon Han, and their daughter Il Han were seen for the last time at a school in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2005004699.CaseDesc: On September 3, 1995, an unidentified woman was found in the Niagara River, near the Maid of the Mist Dock. She had adenomyosis, similar to endometriosis. She had peach/pink polish on finger and toe nails. She is estimated to have been in the water for a few days.

Teeth: Good condition with a few white fillings. Both lower first molars were extracted before death.
Jewelry: Gold, Gold, wearing a 14" chain with crucifix; European 9K gold; manufacturing mark of "ATS"
Jeans: Denim, Blue, Levi's Strauss, size 27 waist and 22 inseam
Scar: Abdomen, 12 cm surgical scar below the naval

Case reference: 2014004062.CaseDesc: Steve Langlois left the Gascon's dock at Port Daniel on April 27, 1996 on a lobster fishing boat. The boat was then hit by a wave and capsized. Mr. Langlois has not been found.

Case reference: 2008015399.CaseDesc: Ronald Desmeules was living in Red Lake, Ontario. While working through some personal issues, Mr. Desmeules traveled to Squamish, British Columbia in September of 1995. On September 14, 1995, while staying with family, he left their residence, and has not been seen or heard from since.

Case reference: 2014003136.CaseDesc: Linda Christian Pedersen was last seen at 9:15 a.m. on June 3, 1981 when she left her boyfriend's apartment in Victoria.  She reportedly returned to her own apartment before 11:30 a.m. and spoke to a male acquaintance.  Her whereabouts since that time are unknown.  Linda left behind all valuables and medication.  She was to have met a girlfriend at 4:30 p.m. but failed to show up for the meeting.  She was interested in theatre production and was reportedly meeting an actor during the evening of June 3, 1981.

Hat: Other, Frequently wore a dark-coloured beret

Case reference: 2013000135.CaseDesc: Harris Hill was last seen on November 10, 2010. He was going into the woods on Westbay Road near Parrsboro, N.S. to drop off apples at his deer stand. Mr. Hill failed to return home.

Case reference: 2012020655.CaseDesc: On May 22, 2008, Wilson Grant Nokohoot was seen for the last time on the 1800 block of Smith Street, Regina, Saskatchewan. It is unusual for Mr. Nokohoot to not have regular contact with family and acquaintances.

Case reference: 2006010599.CaseDesc: William Wabie was last seen as he departed in his 16 foot Starcraft boat from Bag Bay Peninsula, Shoal Lake, near Kenora, Ontario.  Mr. Wabie never arrived at his destination of Cedar Island.

Hat: Straw, Feather on the on side

Case reference: 2014006175.CaseDesc: On July 8, 2013, at approximately 5:30 a.m., Jason Bathily and his twin sister, Clarene Bathily, were seen for the last time with their mother, Adelyne Mounga, in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2017020043.CaseDesc: Louis Judah Gonick was seen being picked up by taxi cab at his University dormitory residence at 7:09 PM, April 16, 2017, and was last seen at 7:32 PM, being dropped off at the Stanley Park causeway.

Case reference: 2018051391.CaseDesc: On September 2, 2018, Himat Singh was last seen at the Ontario Khalsa Darbar Temple in Mississauga, Ontario.  Himat, who was in Canada on a Teaching Visa, packed a bag and was observed entering a vehicle with an unknown individual.

Case reference: 2014004678.CaseDesc: On January 23, 1996, at approximately 4:30pm, Isaac and Sara Floresquintana were last seen at their mother’s home in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2014002407.CaseDesc: Robert Scott Ellis and a friend headed out fishing on June 27, 1973. They left in the morning around 9:30 am and fished until around 6:00 pm when they decided to return home. During the course of the day, poor weather rolled in and the water became quite rough. They started taking in water over the sides of the canoe. Despite the progress they made, one wave eventually rolled the canoe. Both men hung onto the canoe for hours, but Robert eventually tired and let go.  When the friend eventually reached shore, he reported the incident. Dragging and diving operations were initiated and the results were negative. Mr. Ellis is presumed to have drowned. No foul play is suspected in this case.

Case reference: 2014004987.CaseDesc: On September 6, 2004, Cassandra Wright was seen for the last time leaving the Homewood Shelter in Toronto, Ontario. Cassandra said that she would be back in the morning.

Case reference: 2014005158.CaseDesc: Mr. Frederick Lagrelle was last seen on April 12, 1997 in the area of the Sunchild and O’Chiese First Nations in Alberta. It is possible Mr. Lagrelle was seen in Rocky Mountain House, Alberta days after. He was known to walk with a cane and wear a leg/knee brace. Mr. Lagrelle was described by family as having an intellectual disability as a result of a past accident.

Case reference: 2014000003.CaseDesc: The Toronto Police Service is seeking assistance in solving a missing person case.  Mr. Sandhu left his home located in the North West area of Toronto in February of 2004 and never returned.  His family is desperately seeking answers.  Please contact the Toronto Police Service with any information that may assist in locating Mr. Sandhu.

Jacket: Cotton, Black, waist length; zippered front
Scar: Nose, Small scar on bridge of nose

Case reference: 2006015199.CaseDesc: Robert Asher was last seen in Dunnville, Ontario during the winter of 1982. He has not been seen since. Mr. Asher may have been despondent at the time of his disappearance. His vehicle has not been recovered. Mr. Asher was involved with illicit drugs and alcohol at the time of his disappearance.

Jewelry: Gold, Necklace with a diamond ring attached

Case reference: 2014005286.CaseDesc: Karl Behr was last seen on December 25, 1981, in Edmonton, Alberta, when he left a family function to return to his residence. It was noted that Karl's green parka and winter boots were missing from his home. Karl speaks with a slight German accent.

Case reference: 2014005935.CaseDesc: On December 4, 2012, Lucien Bélanger left his residence near the Saint-François River in Drummondville, Quebec. He had made suicidal comments and was despondent at the time of the events.

Case reference: 1999108210.CaseDesc: René Bessette was abducted when he was 8 years old by his father, Roger Bessette, leaving behind his mother and siblings.  His father's car was found abandoned later on the Victoria Bridge in Montreal.  The photos of René have been age-progressed to 40 years old.

Case reference: 2014001603.CaseDesc: On February 2, 1992, Richard Liboiron was seen for the last time as he left a hotel in Gatineau, Quebec. Mr. Liboiron and a friend departed from the hotel on a snowmobile heading in the direction towards Ottawa. The two crossed the Ottawa River and did not make it to the shore.

Case reference: 2007002599.CaseDesc: Mrs. Agnes May Appleyard was last seen standing in her yard, Lot # 2, Conc., # 4 McMurrich Township, Emsdale, Ontario.

Case reference: 2020007642.CaseDesc: On December 5, 1971, Ethel Crespo was last seen by her husband in Toronto, Ontario. During the time of her disappearance, Ethel was two months pregnant.

Case reference: 2014003060.CaseDesc: Pierre Lagacé was last seen on January 5, 2003. At the time, he was living in the Ville Lemoyne sector of Longueuil, Québec. Mr. Lagacé was reported missing by a family member. At the time of his disappearance, he had little money and no car in his name.

Case reference: 2013000120.CaseDesc: In the early morning hours of June 30, 2002, Lisa Marie Young was seen for the last time in Nanaimo, British Columba. On the night of June 29, Lisa travelled to a local bar, and met with some acquaintances. Lisa and her acquaintances accepted a ride from a man to an afterparty. Subsequently, Lisa left with this male driver to get some food, but communicated to her acquaintances that she would be returning to them via taxi. She has not been seen or heard from since. Based on investigational information, the Nanaimo RCMP Serious Crime Unit believes that she may have been met with foul play. Police request that anyone with information contact them directly.

Jewelry: Silver, Aluminum, Stainless Steel, Hoop necklace with medallion
Tattoo: Right Arm, Band of flowers with heart

Case reference: 2013000054.CaseDesc: On December 28, 2006, Carlisle Callum-Drummond was seen for the last time in the Cotes-des-Neiges -Notre-Dame-de-Grace district of Montreal, Quebec. Carlisle left from his home and it is possible that he may be with his father, who is also missing.

Case reference: 2014002034.CaseDesc: In 1968, Christina Littlejohn was last seen on the Roseau River First Nation reserve in Manitoba. Further investigations by the RCMP revealed that Christina had been murdered by her common law partner. In 2002, the RCMP’s Cold Case Unit laid murder charges against her common law partner, however he passed away before the trial commenced. To date Christina’s remains have not been located.

Teeth: Other, She is missing a tooth on the lower right jaw

Case reference: 2012020115.CaseDesc: Glen Moquin was last seen at a summer camp in Abitibi on August 9th, 1993.  His clothes were located on the shore of the lake.

Case reference: 2014001747.CaseDesc: On July 1, 1978, Brenda Bidner was seen for the last time in the Saint-Laurent District in Montreal, Quebec. She was known to travel frequently between Montreal and New York, in the United States. Brenda has not been seen and her family has not heard from her since.

Case reference: 2008023599.CaseDesc: Gordon Andrew Cameron was reported missing by a family member on March 26, 1993. He was last seen on February 28, at Lino's Restaurant and has not been seen or heard from since.  At the time of his disappearance he was self-employed as an auto-body repairman. His shop was located at Brule Road and Highway 2 in Kingston. Foul play is suspected in his disappearance.

Case reference: 2014005209.CaseDesc: On June 30, 1990, at approximately 10:15am, Cindy Clair was seen for the last time near 25 Martha Eaton Way in Toronto, Ontario. Ms. Clair told her roommate she was going for a walk and never returned.

Case reference: 2006001899.CaseDesc: On September 15, 1992, a male was found on the lawn of the Metropolitan United Church, near Queen Street and Church Street in Toronto.

Jewelry: Gold, Chain with a rectangular pendant
Ring: Silver, Aluminum, Stainless Steel, With multicolour stripes
Mark: Left Side Of Head, Pigmented plaque - discolored area

Case reference: 2005003499.CaseDesc: On July 22, 2002, a Caucasian male, was found in the Niagara River, near the Queenston Dock in Niagara Falls. His post-mortem weight was recorded as being 187 lbs, however, this measurement may not represent his actual living weight due to post-mortem changes noted at autopsy. His appendix is present. He may have been a smoker. He was likely in the water for a few days at most.

Hair: Brown, Shorter than collar length, receding hair line
Teeth: He has natural teeth with some amalgam and composite resin restorations

Case reference: 2006003699.CaseDesc: On July 26, 2002, a male, believed to be between the ages of 30 to 40 years old, was found in the Don River, north of the Queen Street East Bridge. His post-mortem weight was recorded as being 217 lbs; however, this measurement may not represent his actual living weight due to post-mortem changes noted at autopsy. His appendix was present. He is thought to have been dead for a few days.

Teeth: Full gold crown lower right first molar, a dental implant replacing upper right central incisor, multiple amalgam restorations.
Shirt: Red, T-shirt with indistinguishable white lettering

Case reference: 2012020042.CaseDesc: On August 2, 1991, Jennifer Anne Regan was seen for the last time in Calgary, Alberta.

Fractured/Broken Bones: Left Chest, Collar bone, according to medical records from 1985
Left Wrist, According to medical records from 1985

Case reference: 2014003927.CaseDesc: On April 8, 1983, Blake Moorehouse was last seen between 2:00 pm and 6:00 pm in Richmond, British Columbia. There is reason to believe that Mr. Moorehouse and his companion Harold Brentzen left for the day to go freshwater fishing. The boat that Mr. Moorehouse and Mr.Brentzen were on board was recovered approximately 1.2 km north of the Roberts Creek Terminal. Mr. Brentzen's body was recovered near the boat, but Mr. Moorehouse was not located.

Case reference: 2016068993.CaseDesc: On May 14, 1975, the body of a Caucasian female was found floating in the Detroit River near Fighting Island.Her post-mortem weight was recorded as being between 110-150 lbs and her length was measured at 5'4", however, these measurements may not represent her actual living weight and height due to post-mortem changes noted at autopsy. She had pierced ears and her appendix was present. She is believed to have been in the water a few days to a week.

Jewelry: Chain necklace with a tiny bell, a key, and a stone bead pendant.
Shoes: Red, white, and blue laced shoes with a star design on the white stripes
Belt: Silver tie belt made of cloth
Jacket: Cloth, Brown, Waist length jacket, possibly imitation fur
Mark: Abdomen, Abdominal stretch marks suggesting she may have been pregnant at one time

Case reference: 2015011640.CaseDesc: On February 2, 1995, the body of an adult male believed to be between the ages of 40-60 was found in an apartment on Ekers Avenue in Montreal, Quebec. He was homeless and may have been known as Bruno. He had no ID, only a paper in his personal belongings on which was inscribed "Bruno Slezak Josef".

Sweater: Wool, Blue, Grey, With gray and red patterns

Case reference: 2014004917.CaseDesc: Robert Rudish and Lee Vrba arrived in Island Lake Manitoba on June 11, 1972, to fish. On June 17, RCMP received a report that a canoe was found overturned in the water. The canoe was soon identified as belonging to Mr. Vrba. RCMP Investigators surmised the men went missing on either the Thursday or the Friday. The weather on both days was extreme, with high winds gusting to 30 mph, which caused the lake to be quite rough. Neither of the two men have been located and it is presumed both drowned.

Tattoo: tattoo on right or left forearm

Case reference: 2014005156.CaseDesc: On October 15, 2002, Jeanne Ouellette was seen for the last time at a Starbucks coffeehouse in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2014005219.CaseDesc: Lori Lee Berens was last seen January 15, 1985 in the Winnipeg area. Lori has not made contact with her family since then and her whereabouts remain unknown.

Hair: Brown, Straight, Often wore a ponytail

Case reference: 2014001826.CaseDesc: On November 5, 1960, Andrew Moses was last seen as he left his base camp on Brunswick Lake in Algoma County, Ontario. Andrew had left the base camp to check his trap line, which was approximately 5 miles in length near Ericson Creek. On November 13, 1960, a small search group was formed when Andrew did not return. The group located a rifle belonging to Andrew leaning against a tree. The following day, a half eaten beaver was located inside of a nearby camp on Ericson creek. The camp and trap line were searched one year later, and it revealed that it was vacant with no signs of being visited.

Case reference: 2014002695.CaseDesc: Harold Wagner was last seen on June 4, 1988, at Fur Lake in the Mont Nebo district, SK. Mr. Wagner was swimming from his boat when he disappeared.

Shorts: Cloth, White, Red, White swim trunks with red, blue and red stripes

Case reference: 2014004412.CaseDesc: On July 20, 1998, Mohammad Oloumi was last seen in Brampton.  It is believed that Mohammad may have travelled to an unknown destination in Asia.

Case reference: 2016008383.CaseDesc: On December 18, 2015, Adam Kazibwe was last seen at his school in Brampton.  It is believed that on February 18, 2016, Adam's mother Rosemarie Tumusiime and father Robert Kazibwe, travelled from Brampton to Kabale, Uganda with their twin children Adam and Destiny.  Further investigation has not been able to confirm the well-being of Adam or of his sister Destiny.

Case reference: 2014005278.CaseDesc: On July 14, 2009, Yashpal Mehay left his residence in Surrey BC, and was scheduled to travel to Clinton BC, where he co-owned and operated a Petro Canada Gas Station with family. Yashpal Mehay was last seen at the Costco in Abbotsford BC, at 1450 hours on July 14, 2009, where he purchased tobacco, food and gas. Mr. Mehay failed to arrive at his destination in Clinton BC, and there has been no communication with the family. He was very familiar with this route as he travelled it every other week. The Surrey RCMP has conducted extensive searches along the travelled route with negative results.

Shirt: Green, White, Long sleeve "American Eagle" polo

Case reference: 2014004451.CaseDesc: On February 22, 1964, Marie Mike was seen for the last time leaving a residence on the Beardy's/Okemasis First Nation Reserve near Rosthern, Saskatchewan.

Case reference: 2014025774.CaseDesc: In August 2014, Pawel Przybyla was reported missing by his family. He was last believed to be in the Edmonton, Alberta area.

Case reference: 2018063443.CaseDesc: On July 2, 2003, at approximately 7:00 a.m., Sergio Rodriguez was seen for the last time by his wife in Toronto, Ontario. When Sergio’s wife had returned home from work, he and all of his belongings were gone.

Case reference: 2014001255.CaseDesc: On October 28, 1979, Robert Caldicott last spoke with his father on the telephone. Mr. Caldicott failed to attend several appointments in the following days.

Case reference: 2014031015.CaseDesc: A male was located, deceased in a wooded area near the Halifax International Airport. No identification was located in the area. A composite sketch and reconstruction model of the male have been developed, however the male remains unidentified.

Case reference: 2020021899.CaseDesc: Nowell HALFE was last seen by family in Edmonton, Alberta in 2013. The last documented occurrence for HALFE puts him in Edmonton, Alberta in January of 2014.

Case reference: 2005006699.CaseDesc: On May 22, 2003, an unidentified man believed to be between 50 and 60 years old, was found in the woods off of Humberwood Boulevard, near Highway 427 and Rexdale Blvd., in Toronto. He was found beneath an overturned picnic table that he may have been using for shelter. His post-mortem length was reported to be between 5’0"-5’1" and his weight was 122lbs. Found within the vicinity of his body was a right black leather-type boot, a black sock, a white baseball hat, a green winter jacket, a navy-coloured winter jacket, a black long-sleeved shirt, a black belt and an empty bottle of Listerine mouthwash. It is believed that death occurred within 1-2 days of his discovery.

Teeth: Visible Missing, He has multiple teeth missing with only one tooth remaining in his lower jaw
Other: Lighter and bus ticket in pocket
Boots: Leather, Black, Left boot only, size 9

Case reference: 2021037678.CaseDesc: On August 20, 2021, Vaughn Baumgardt was seen for the last time when he left a residence in Powell River, British Columbia. Vaughn has not been seen or heard from since.

Shoes: Black, Skater, Size 10, known to wear black DVS brand skater shoes

Case reference: 2013000095.CaseDesc: On October 19, 1969 Ronald Bonkowski went fishing with two friends in the Winnipeg River. Upon arriving at their desired location, the party anchored their boat in fast moving water. The anchor caught on the bottom of the river and pulled the boat down, causing it to over turn. All three men were thrown into the water. Two of the men were able to swim to the shore, however Mr. Bonkowski was observed going under the water. The over turned boat was found with an anchor line attached at the dam site. Searches were conducted by water and land, however Ronald Bonkowski was never located. He is presumed dead due to drowning.

Case reference: 2014003132.CaseDesc: On December 29, 1978, Sharon Drover was seen for the last time. Ms. Drover left her boarding house located in downtown St. John's, Newfoundland and arrived for her evening shift at McDonald’s restaurant. She finished her shift after midnight.

Case reference: 2014006142.CaseDesc: On May 23, 2013, at approximately 6:30 a.m., John Lioudakis was seen for the last time at the Toronto Pearson International Airport, in Toronto, Ontario. John flew to Mexico and was scheduled to return on May 31, 2013, but he never boarded the flight.

Tattoo: Left Ankle, On calf; unknown animal

Case reference: 2014001575.CaseDesc: On March 12, 1983, Samuel Amos Quatell was reported missing from the fishing vessel “ISE II”, near Steep Island, BC. Steep Island is located near Seymour Narrows; between Quadra Island and Campbell River, BC. Samuel was last seen near the rear of the vessel, by the ship’s crew.  An extensive search failed to locate Samuel. The tidal currents near the island are extremely strong and any person in the water could travel a great distance in a short period of time.

Amputation: Left Hand, Missing tip of ring finger

Case reference: 2014005582.CaseDesc: Lionel Joseph Daigle went missing from the New Direction Special Care home, located on the Westside of the City of Saint John. Mr. Daigle was last seen April 3, 2011. He is reported to have mental health issues and requires regular medication. The public is urged to contact the Saint John Police Force with any information concerning his whereabouts.

Jacket: Grey, Winter jacket, 3/4 length with hood

Case reference: 2018041450.CaseDesc: On July 19, 1999, Fakhri Daoud was seen for the last time in Toronto, Ontario. Fakhri had returned to his residence to gather some money, his passport, and some of his personal belongings. The day before, he had purchased a one-way flight ticket to Aman, Jordan.

Case reference: 2016062636.CaseDesc:
On November 6, 2016, Maxwell Harvey Mayling was reported missing from Prince George, British Columbia.  Mr. Mayling was last heard from in early October, 2016 by friends and family.  Mr. Mayling is known to frequent both the Prince George and Fort St John municipalities, and was last known to have been in Prince George since July 2016.

Mr. Mayling's maroon 1995 Ford Taurus was located in late November, 2016 in Prince George, however all other efforts to locate Mr. Mayling have been unsuccessful.

Case reference: 2014001485.CaseDesc: On July 31, 1981, Mohamad Daher was seen for the last time as he left his residence, in the Anjou district in Montreal, Quebec, for a business meeting. His vehicle was found at Le Boulevard Shopping Centre in the Saint-Leonard neighbourhood. Mohamad has not been seen or heard from since.

Case reference: 2014005938.CaseDesc: In December 2010, Mashia Rezadoust was seen for the last time by her father in Toronto, Ontario. Mashia was taken to China by her mother, but has never returned.

Case reference: 2014003956.CaseDesc: Mary Louise Lejeune was last seen on February 23, 1991 in Montreal, Quebec. She left without notifying her family and she has not been heard from since.

Coat: Wool, Grey, Purple collar and wrists

Case reference: 2014006465.CaseDesc: On January 18, 2014, Sofi Ma was seen for the last time with her father, Moses Ma, in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2021059908.CaseDesc: On June 16, 2016, the partial remains of an unidentified man were recovered in Renews, Newfoundland. Between 2016 and 2018, additional remains belonging to this man were recovered.

Case reference: 2014005508.CaseDesc: In October 2010, Maxime Jacques left Winnipeg, Manitoba by bus to visit family in Trois-Rivières, Quebec. On October 30, 2010, Mr. Jacques never arrived at his destination and his family reported him as missing.

Case reference: 2014005412.CaseDesc: On March 2, 2010, Ian Murray was seen for the last time as he left the Mental Health Unit at the Cape Breton Regional Hospital in Sydney, Nova Scotia. During the time of his disappearance, Ian was suffering from schizophrenia and had stopped taking his medication.

Case reference: 2014001970.CaseDesc: On December 20, 1996, Wayne Hansen was seen for the last time as he checked himself out of a hospital in Edmonton, Alberta.

Case reference: 2014003583.CaseDesc: Patrick Ratchford was last seen at a prospect site at Lake Geneva on October 28, 1974. He intended to walk to Highway 144 and catch a ride to Timmins; he was never seen again. Police investigation to date cannot rule out the possibility that Patrick has been a victim of foul play due to the duration of time since he went missing.

Case reference: 2014003036.CaseDesc: Originally from Winnipeg, Manitoba, Regan Pace Ambrose is believed to have gone missing in Japan. After being recruited to work at a Japanese hospital, Miss Ambrose moved to Tokuyama, Yamaguchi, Japan. She was last seen on January 11, 1998 after finishing a shift at work. She was reportedly seen in the area of Mount Aso in Kumamoto, Kyushu Japan on January 10th, 1998. Japanese and Canadian authorities investigated; however, met with negative results.

Case reference: 2014001540.CaseDesc: Marie Laliberté was a resident of east Vancouver who was engaged in a high risk lifestyle. She was last seen by her resource worker on January 1, 1997. Due to her increasingly sporadic contact with family and a lack of social interaction with others, she was not reported missing until March 8, 2002.

Case reference: 2006011999.CaseDesc: On November 8, 1972, Henry King and Vancel Mcleod left King's Fishing Camp on Lake Huron to travel by boat to Thessalon where they were to deliver fish. They never arrived at the intended destination.

Scar: Left Thumb, 1/2 to 3/4 inch in length.

Case reference: 2005069040.CaseDesc: Yaseen is believed to be with his mother, Marina Zlonikova. They may be in the Ukraine.

Case reference: 2008008099.CaseDesc: Ronald Wallin was canoeing in Upper Manitou Lake located south of Dryden.  Mr. Wallin suffered from what appeared to be a seizure and fell into the water disappering beneath the boat. The area was searched, but Mr. Wallin was not found.

Case reference: 2014011272.CaseDesc: During the morning of June 10, 2014, Yvonne Wallace left her residence. She has not been seen or heard from since.

Case reference: 2022001264.CaseDesc: On January 10, 2022, Ian Indridson was seen for the last time at his residence in Victoria, British Columbia.  Ian has not been seen or heard from since.

Shirt: Black, Blue, Eddie Bauer Brand, waffle knit, black or blue

Case reference: 2018040305.CaseDesc: On the morning of April 10, 2001, Joo Youn was seen for the last time as she sent her children off to school in Toronto, Ontario. Later that day, when Joo’s husband returned home she was gone and she had left a note.

Case reference: 2012020129.CaseDesc: Nadine Lussier and Dominic Gauthier worked at a convenience store in Ste-Sophie. They were seen for the last time Wednesday, June 16th 2004. They left the convenience store around 3:00 p.m., and were then seen in a Prévost restaurant. Ms.Lussier's vehicle had not moved from the restaurant from the evening of Wednesday, June 16th 2004 and the time Dominic Gauthier's mother reported their disappearance on Friday June 18th 2004.

Case reference: 2014006397.CaseDesc: On January 2, 2014, Joshua Jeffs was reported missing in Revelstoke, British Columbia. On December 19, 2013, a vehicle driven by Joshua was located unoccupied at the entrance to a popular outdoor recreation area known as "12 Mile", south of Revelstoke, British Columbia. Joshua has not been seen or heard from since.

Shirt: Black, Dark Blue, Sweatshirt, Hooded Sweatshirt with white writing
Grey, T-Shirt, T-shirt worn underneath SPURS Jersey
White, Jersey, Spurs white basketball jersey with #9 on the front
Pants: Black, Trackpants with white stripes along the sides
Tattoo: Right Upper Arm , Text “4LIFE”, back of right arm
Left Upper Arm, Text “DEUCE”, back of left arm
Left Forearm, Text “NORTH SIDE MOB MASK FACE”

Case reference: 2006010999.CaseDesc: It is believed that Sander Lingman became lost while staking claims near Gripp Lake, 69 kilometres north west of Nakina, Ontario. They were unable to find Mr Lingman, despite intensive searches of the area.

Case reference: 2014002549.CaseDesc: Wladyslaw Klisko was last seen on September 11, 1983, in Montreal. He left his house in the morning to go to church. He took the bus but was not seen at the church.

Case reference: 2013000079.CaseDesc: Gilles Chiasson has been missing from Montreal since April 18, 1995. Mr. Chiasson took a taxi after a night out in a bar and was never seen again.

Case reference: 2008019699.CaseDesc: On April 10, 2006 Mohmud Jiwani left his residence in Oakville to attend a business meeting in Toronto. He never returned to his Oakville residence. His vehicle was later located in the Jarvis and Dundas area of Toronto. Despite an extensive investigation, no further information has been uncovered regarding his disappearance.

Pants: Dark Blue, Navy blue suit pants

Case reference: 2014003446.CaseDesc: Dawn Crey was a resident of the downtown east side of Vancouver; she was engaged in a high risk lifestyle. She was reported missing on December 11, 2000 after failing to attend a medical appointment. Foul play is suspected in Ms. Crey's disappearance.

Case reference: 2006003799.CaseDesc: On September 28, 2002, a Black male, believed to be between the ages of 20 to 30 years old, was found in Lake Ontario, approximately 1 mile south of Bluffers Park, at the foot of Brimley Road in Toronto. His post-mortem weight was recorded as being 160 lbs and his length was measured at 5’9”-5’11”, however, these measurements may not represent his actual living weight and height due to post-mortem changes noted at autopsy. His appendix was present. He is thought to have been dead for a few days.

Teeth: Had natural teeth with no restorations.
Underwear: White, Logo "X-20" on the elastic band. The elastic band was tied on right side, as if they were too big.

Case reference: 2014004703.CaseDesc: On August 13, 1995, Marie-Josée Boisjoli left her home in Laval, QC, mentioning that she was going to an appointment without giving any further details. The next day, her vehicle and personal belongings were found at the family cottage, located in the Gélinas Lake area in Mont-Tremblant. She has not been seen since.

Case reference: 2013000045.CaseDesc: On September 14, 1964, at approximately 11:00 p.m., Noreen Greenly was seen for the last time leaving her friend’s house. Noreen had told her friend that she was going to wait for the bus at the bus stop across the street. The bus driver was interviewed and he stated that he did not pick her up. A witness had reported seeing a young girl get into a small blue car, and sit close to the driver at approximately the same time and location. The car was described as a 1957 to 1959 Ford Perfect which was in good condition.

Jewelry: Silver, Aluminum, Stainless Steel, Blue, A thin necklace with blue pendant
Purse: Dark Blue, dome fastener, change purse with $0.70 inside
Scar: Right Knee, Center of knee cap

Case reference: 2014004048.CaseDesc: Dwayne Allen Rideout was last seen on September 24, 1999 at the Generator Cabaret on 3rd Avenue in Prince George, British Columbia.

Case reference: 2014032043.CaseDesc:
On May 22nd, 1970, Philomena Sisson, age 68, was reported missing by her son, Harry Jack.  She had gone missing a few days earlier from his house on Boys Rd. in Duncan, BC.  Mrs. Sisson was reported to be an alcoholic who occasionally went missing for several days at a time. She also suffered from dementia. 
 
Mrs. Sisson's last surviving son has since passed away.  There was never any indication of foul play in her disappearance.

Case reference: 2012020110.CaseDesc: On September 23 2000, Nathalie Godbout was seen for the last time in the Saint-Romuald district in Lévis, Quebec. Nathalie was the mother of two children.

Case reference: 2008018199.CaseDesc: Carl Braum and Thomas Lumsden were last seen on the morning of May 19, 1974, in a 14 foot fiberglass canoe, travelling in a northerly direction in the area of Depot Harbor. It was believed that they were travelling to the Killbear Park area. There were no lifejackets in the canoe.

Case reference: 2018062782.CaseDesc: On April 12, 1993, at approximately 4:30pm, Helen Bialowas was last seen leaving her residence in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2014005313.CaseDesc: On September 24, 2007, Azelea Brown last spoke to her mother who was overseas.

Case reference: 2014001743.CaseDesc: Knut Thielemann was last seen walking near the Athabasca Falls in Jasper National Park.

Case reference: 2006017699.CaseDesc: Marianne Minor was a resident of the St. Thomas Psychiatric Hospital in 1984. She left her ward to go to the canteen and has never been seen again.

Case reference: 2014002350.CaseDesc: On May 29th, 1990 Pierre Beaudoin left his residence in Hebron, Prince Edward Island. Police later confirmed that Mr. Beaudoin stayed at the Hotel Francis in New Richmond, Quebec and was seen for the last time on May 31, 1990, when he checked out of the hotel. Pierre’s truck and personal belongings were found in a dense, wooded area approximately 45 miles southeast of Route 275 in Balmoral, New Brunswick on August 17th, 1990.
